data.value:
Verse 1:
Too many people are tryin' to change me
Too many people are lookin' to rearrange me
But the last thing I'll ever do
To prove that I am a man like you

Verse 2
Is work from nine to five tryin' to keep myself alive
And have to listen every day to everybody's jive
And concentrate my time on simply tryin' to make a dime
And agitate my mind on tryin' to make our values rhyme

Chorus:
Too many things that I've got to do
Too many bags that I've got to run through
And the last thing I'll ever do
To prove that I am a man like you

Bridge:
Is turn away the girls even though I want a whirl
And worry just because that's what everybody else does
And chase myself around so that I'm not called a clown
Wear a suit and tie when I'd rather sit and die

Verse 1:
You want to relax,
All you gotta do is let me do everything,
Just let go of your tasks,
Don't worry, everything will be just fine.

Chorus:
Find yourself inside your mind
Don't be in panic, be relaxed.

Verse 2:
Find your peace, find your strength,
And when you reach your confidence,
Lying down, relaxing, and sensing the nature.

Bridge:
Find that you're not the kind to face the ugliness of reality,
Stay by the truth and we will find the calmness to stay in all its splendid beauty.
Verse 1:
Too many people trying to change me
Looking to attack me verbally
The last thing I'll ever do
Is to please narrow-minded people like you

Pre-Chorus:
You're too weak trying to please the masses
Looking to conform to the mainstream

Chorus:
Too many things that I got to beware
Social rules that I got to run through
The last thing I'll ever do
Is to prove that I am thinking like you

Verse 2:
Working from nine to five trying to keep myself alive
Listening everyday to what people want to talk about
Concentrating my time on just trying to make a dime
Agitating my mind on trying to make my mind to match the reality

Pre-Chorus:
You're too weak trying to please everyone
Looking to conform to stereotypes

Bridge:
Turning away the girls even though I want a wife
Worrying just because I feel incomplete
Doing what women want so that I'm not called a clown
Wearing a suit and tie when I'd rather sit and die
Verse 3:
City lights shining in the dark
Don't worry it's just life
Their trust have reached balance
You'll find you'll have a lovely time
80s glam rock, climatical, with guitar solo

active_struct.name: The Instrumental Impression
attrs: utilizes multiple prechoruses for variation in the chorus
includes a solo for instrumental showcase
ends with a strong and memorable chorus in the outro

struct_suggs.name: The Explosive Escalation
attrs: provides a balance between verses and choruses
includes a bridge for variety and climax
has a clear build up to the final chorus in the outro

struct_suggs.name: The Intense Introvert
attrs: has a strong and attention-grabbing intro
allows for development and variation in the chorus with multiple prechoruses
includes a bridge for a change in tempo and intensity

struct_suggs.name: The Smooth Synergy
attrs: focuses on alternating verses and choruses
includes an instrumental section for a break and showcase
clearly builds up to the final chorus in the outro

struct_suggs.name: The Instrumental Impression
attrs: utilizes multiple prechoruses for variation in the chorus
includes a solo for instrumental showcase
ends with a strong and memorable chorus in the outro

struct_suggs.name: The Dynamic Drive
attrs: focuses on alternating verses and choruses
utilizes an intro and instrumental section for a break and buildup to the chorus
has room for a longer story arc with multiple choruses

struct_suggs.name: The Enigmatic Energy
attrs: has a strong and attention-grabbing intro
includes a prechorus for variation in the chorus
provides a break and buildup in the bridge before the climax in the final chorus

struct_suggs.name: The Experimental Excitement
attrs: starts with an instrumental intro to captivate the listener's attention
includes a solo and bridge for variation and development
builds up to the final chorus in the outro

struct_suggs.name: The Melodious Makeover
attrs: utilizes multiple prechoruses for variation in the chorus
includes an instrumental theme melody for a memorable hook
provides a clear buildup to the final chorus in the outro

struct_suggs.name: The Seamless Storyteller
attrs: focuses on alternating verses and choruses with an increasing intensity
includes a bridge for a change in tempo and intensity
ends with a strong and memorable final chorus in the outro

struct_suggs.name: The Instrumental Odyssey
attrs: utilizes an intro and instrumental section for a break and development
includes a solo and prechorus for variation in the chorus
has a clear buildup to the final chorus in the outro.

themes.text: Embracing individualistic sexuality and defying societal norms and expectations
Seeking spiritual fulfillment outside of organized religion and embracing personal beliefs
Exploring and pushing the boundaries of pleasure and desire

allegories.text: A scientific experiment to enhance pleasure and push boundaries, represented by a bright purple light
A spiritual awakening and questioning of traditional beliefs, symbolized by a golden yellow light
The pressure of living in a secular society and the desire to connect with something higher, depicted by a dark grey storm
The journey of a mystic seeker, portrayed as a swirling mix of vibrant colors
The internal battle between personal pleasure and societal expectations, shown as a clash of red

contents.text: He couldn't shake the feeling of shame and fear that came with his kinky desires, but his scientific mind couldn't resist the allure of enhancement. As an atheist in a spiritual-seeking society, he felt like a mystic practitioner in a world of new age believers. Yet, he remained true to himself, worshiping his own inner desires and embracing his individual spirituality in a secular society. But as a man expected to conform to societal norms, he struggled to reconcile his reasonable nature with his trope-reinforcing actions. In the end, he found freedom and solace in his explicit exploration of pleasure and his individual-focused outlook on life.

She was a confident and adventurous spirit, always pushing the boundaries and seeking new experiences. As a strong and liberal woman, she rejected the societal expectations placed on her and embraced her individualistic nature. Despite facing criticism and judgment, she remained true to herself, seeking the truth and honesty in all aspects of her life. With a libertarian mindset, she reveled in the pleasures of life and found true acceptance and fulfillment in her sexual and spiritual journeys.

He was a melancholic soul, burdened by the weight of societal norms and expectations. But deep down, he harbored a serious and heavy desire for something more, something beyond the mundane. In a world that seemed closed off to his individuality, he found solace in embracing his atheistic beliefs and rejecting the divine worshipers around him. With a playful and humorous outlook, he embraced the idea of a new age of individualistic spirituality, finding hope and optimism in his unconventional path.
